definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.chinese: 小数点显然放错位置了。

sentences.english: The difference is that the number mask allows for decimal points.
sentences.chinese: 不同之处在于，这里的数字掩码允许小数点。

sentences.english: Take out percent sign, move decimal points two places to the left.
sentences.chinese: 去掉百分号，小数点向左移动两位。

sentences.english: Everything from the decimal point over gets chopped off.
sentences.chinese: 所有小数点后面的数值都被砍掉了。

sentences.english: That means paying too much attention to the numbers after the decimal point doesn't make sense.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着过多关注小数点后面的数字没有多大意义。

sentences.english: Something with a decimal point and numbers thereafter.
sentences.chinese: 也就是小数点后还有数字。

sentences.english: The little dot near the centre is the decimal point.
sentences.chinese: 怪圈中心近处的那个小圆圈，就是小数点。

sentences.english: The integer portion, to the left of the decimal point, represents the date.
sentences.chinese: 小数点左边的整数部分表示日期。

sentences.english: You missed a decimal point read.

definition: to round up to the nearest integer/to discard four, but treat five as whole (of decimal points)
small figure/small amount/the part of a number to the right of the decimal point (or radix point)/fractional part of a number/number between 0 and 1/decimal fraction
recurring section of a rational decimal
(math.) the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter (π)
